DataElement.preferredName: Person Ventricular Arrhythmia Arrhythmia Medication Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has an arrhythmia, any variation from the normal rate or rhythm (which may include the origin of the impulse and/or its subsequent propagation) requiring medication, a drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease, as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Ventricular Arrhythmia Arrhythmia Medication Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having an arrhythmia, any variation from the normal rate or rhythm (which may include the origin of the impulse and/or its subsequent propagation) requiring medication, a drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease, as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Ventricular arrhythmia Arrhythmia Medication Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia that originates in the ventricles.:Arrhythmia; an abnormal rate of muscle contractions in the heart.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia that originates in the ventricles.
Any variation from the normal rate or rhythm (which may include the origin of the impulse and/or its subsequent propagation) in the heart.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have serious cardiac arrhythmia requiring medication (except for asymptomatic atrial fibrillation with controlled ventricular rate)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a histo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of serious ventricular arrhythmia (ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation) or arrhythmias requiring anti-arrhythmic medications (except for atrial fibrillation that is well controlled with anti-arrhythmic medication)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of serious ventricular arrhythmia (ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation) or arrhythmias requiring anti-arrhythmic medications

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of serious ventricular arrhythmia (ie. ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation) or serious cardiac arrhythmia requiring medication (except for asymptomatic atrial fibrillation with controlled ventricular rate)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any history of clinically significant ventricular arrhythmias (such as ventricular tachycardia, ventricular fibrillation, or Torsades de pointes)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have serious cardiac arrhythmia requiring medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of cardiac arrhythmias requiring anti-arrhythmic medications (except for atrial fibrillation that is well controlled with anti-arrhythmic medication)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of serious ventricular arrhythmia (i.e., ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation) or cardiac arrhythmias requiring anti-arrhythmic medications (except for atrial fibrillation that is well controlled with anti-arrhythmic medication)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior use of any anti-arrhythmic medication (except for beta-blockers), including lidocaine, linezolid, ipratropium, or medications with strong cholinergic properties (including neostigmine, a tricyclic antidepressant or a monoamine oxidase inhibitor)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or presence of significant ventricular or atrial tachyarrhythmia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior use of an anti-arrhythmic medication

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have ventricular tachycardia or supraventricular tachycardia that requires treatment with Class IA antiarrhythmic drugs (e.g., quinidine, procainamide, disopryamide) or Class III antiarrhythmic drug (e.g., sotalol, amiodarone, dofetilide)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1804 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any history of, current symptoms, or signs of supraventricular tachycardia, atrial fibrillation, and/or atrial flutter?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any clinically significant ventricular arrhythmias within 12 months prior to registration?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
